intro: Phyllanthodendron dunnianum, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a climbing shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, white seeds. It is often found in forest understories and is adapted to humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal uses, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
